channel.title: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines
channel.description: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: In 1984, as a young delegate from the great state of Montana, I cast my vote for President Ronald Reagan in Dallas.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: For the past 28 years, I have built businesses and created hundreds of jobs. My wife Cindy and I have been married for 25 years and are the parents of four great kids.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: Now, out-of-control spending, crushing debt, and job-destroying regulations threaten our children's future.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: We have more government than ever before. Our economy is stagnant, families are struggling, and the America we love is threatened.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: Washington does NOT create jobs, the people do.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: I'm grateful that six generations of my family have called Montana home.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: My great-great grandmother left Norway and came to Montana in search of a better future.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: As a widow with seven children, she homesteaded on the plains of northern Montana.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: On her tombstone are three simple words: "Saved by Grace."
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: The words "Saved by Government" would never have crossed her mind. She put her faith in God not Government.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines

item.title: In 70 days, our country faces a pivotal election -- and our choice is clear. We can do better and we will do better when we elect Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan. Thank you and God bless.
item.author: Montana Congressional Candidate Steve Daines
